page.title: 07Michael Honnor-artist.
page.content: Local artist,Michael Honnor,lives in a remote old farmhouse on the eastern edge of Hanger Down;2 miles up a dirt track with no electricity or mains water supply. Michael says,since childhood,he wanted such a magical place,where he could concentrate on his painting,which features the local landscape of hills,trees and water.He paints the same subjects,from life, over and over because he is interested in the feeling of "place",always changing while still evoking memories. Michael works in oils,acrylics,water- colours and lithography on stones.He works all year round and in winter watercolours often freeze on the open moor. Michael's work sympathetically portrays the colours and atmosphere of local moorland and the environs of the river Erme.
